subject: Europäische Integration I (European Integration I)
why_exam_relevance: This document IS the exam paper itself (Prüfung FS 22), making it the single most relevant document for understanding the exact structure, format, grading scheme, rules, and time constraints of the assessment. It provides the blueprint for how knowledge will be tested.
likely_exam_questions: Dual-Choice (True/False or A/B statements) testing factual recall.
Multiple-Choice with multiple correct answers, requiring precise knowledge (graded on a sliding scale: 2 pts for perfect, 1 pt for one error, 0 pts for >1 error).
Short-answer questions (Kurzantwortfragen) drawn from a pre-defined 'Fragenkatalog', requiring concise, structured written answers for high point value (10 pts each).
connections: Core curriculum of 'Europäische Integration I' course
Specific 'Fragenkatalog' referenced for Part III (not included in this snippet)
difficulty_spikes: Part III (Kurzantwortfragen). These are worth 10 points each, indicating they require substantive, well-argued answers on complex topics from the course's core question catalog. The grading for Multiple-Choice is also stringent, where more than one error results in zero points, demanding high precision.
prerequisites: Completion of the 'Europäische Integration I' course lectures and readings.
Familiarity with the specific 'Fragenkatalog' for the short-answer section.
Understanding of core theories, history, institutions, and policies of European integration.
summary: This is the official exam paper for the European Integration I course (FS 22) at the University of Lucerne. It outlines a 90-minute exam divided into three parts: Dual-Choice, Multiple-Choice, and Short-Answer questions, each with specific point values and strict grading rules. The document primarily details the exam's administrative structure, rules of conduct, and format, rather than substantive course content, which would be found in the referenced 'Fragenkatalog' and course materials.
